actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to make Presidential Election Day a legal public holiday.

summary.text: Makes Presidential Election Day, the first Tuesday after the first Monday in November in 1976, and in every fourth year thereafter, a legal public holiday. (Amends 5 U.S.C. 6103(a))

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to make Presidential Election Day a legal public holiday.
